Active straight leg raising not possible.” Classification of neck of femur fracture: Depending on the site Subcapital Incidence -70% Just below the head at site of epiphyseal plate Transcervical 20% of the fracture Fracture line runs across the neck of femur Basal 10% of the fractures. questions.text: Which of the position is being tested in the picture given below? Refer Colour Plate 53)

Which of the following is the most common squeal of traumatic dislocation of shoulder? DISLOCATION OF SHOULDER AND SQUEAL “Most common early complication of Anterior Dislocation is – NERVE INJURY (CIRCUMFLEX BRANCH OF AXILLARY NERVE > AXILLARY NERVE) Most common complication is Recurrent dislocation (50% of all shoulder dislocations recurrently dislocate) SHOULDER DISLOCATION Shoulder dislocation can be anterior or posterior. Anterior shoulder dislocation is the most common amounting to approximately 98% Anterior Dislocation of the Shoulder Mechanism: Hyperabduction and external rotation strain.The deltoid bulge is lost and it appears as a hollowDugas test: Inability to touch the opposite shoulder.Hamilton Ruler TestA ruler is placed from the acromian and lateral condyle, because of the deltoid bulge it’s not possible to make the points in a line. In case of dislocation it’s possible to touch the both points in a line. Reduction of Dislocation

options.label: A
options.text: Normal shoulder healing and normal movements

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding Gallezi fracture dislocation? GALLEZI FRACTURE DISLOCATION “Dislocation or subluxation of the distal radio-ulnar joint in association with a solitary fracture of the radius at the junction of the middle and distal third” “Fracture of the lower third of the radius with dislocation or subluxation of the distal radio-ulnar joint” “Distal radioulnar joint (DRUJ) injury” (Gives Piano Key Sign) Primary stabilizers of DRUJ are: Volar and dorsal radioulnar ligaments TFCC If DRUJ is Disrupted – TFCC can get injured TFCC (triangular fibrocartilage complex) Contributes to the Stability of ELBOW Volar Compenents Volar radioulnar ligament Ulnotriquetral ligament Ulnolunate ligament Ulna components Triangular ligament Ulna collateral ligament Meniscal homologue Dorsal components Dorsal radioulnar ligament Extensor carpi ulnaris tendon sheath

options.label: A
options.text: Interossesous membrane tear with ulnar shaft fracture

options.label: B
options.text: Radial collateral ligament tear with interosseousmembrance tear with radial shaft fracture

options.label: C
options.text: Interosseous membrane tear with triangular fibrocartilage complex (TFCC) tear and ulnar shaft fracture

options.label: D
options.text: Interosseous membrane tear with triangular fibrocartilage complex (TFCC) tear and radial shaft fracture

questions.correct_answer: D. Interosseous membrane tear with triangular fibrocartilage complex (TFCC) tear and radial shaft fracture

questions.text: A patient came with complaints of inability to move his 4th and 5th digit, cannot hold pen and he was not able to hold paper between fingers. Which of the following site given below is the probable cause of injury to the nerve in question? Refer Colour plate 54 First we will analyse the symptoms and signs one by one Inability to move his 4th and 5th digit, Suspect Ulnar Nerve Involvement CANNOT HOLD PEN Intrinsics of hand affected (musicians nerve, fine movements) suspect ulnar nerve This is not Pen Test used for median nerve palsyNot able to hold paper between fingers. Think Card Test (Palmar interossei supplied by ulnar nerve)So concluding, the most probable nerve injured in this case is Ulnar nerve.
Which of the following is the treatment of patella fracture? This is a repeat and straight forward question. We will look at patellar fractures below:

Which of the following is bone holding forceps used in orthopaedic surgeries? Refer Colour plate 55 This is again to test the clinical acumen of MBBS graduate. Naming of the instruments above: a. Babcock forceps b. Bone-holding forceps c. Reduction forceps d. Hack saw blade Last AIIMS had a question on general surgical instruments. Gradually AIIMS is shifting not only to test the memory of students also by judging the overall acumen of a medical graduate. Looks like a positive sign J

Haglund deformity is seen in which of the following joints: HAGLUND DEFORMITY (PUMP BUMP) AND RETROCALCANEAL BURSITIS Is caused by chronic inflammation of the adventitious superficial pretendinous Achilles bursa (that separates the Achilles tendon from the overlying skin). Bursitis usually is caused by chronic irritation from a shoe heel, modification of shoe wear usually relieves symptoms.This deformity usually occurs in young women in their twenties or thirties Treatment: Conservative If conservative measures fail then Calcaneal osteotomy

The growth of cartilage following fracture will be increased by which of the following: This is a direct repeat question from previous AIIMS The mechanical stability of the fracture site influences the repair process.

options.label: D
options.text: Repeated tiny movements at the fracture site

questions.correct_answer: D. Repeated tiny movements at the fracture site

questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Undisplaced #: POP immobilization for 3 weeks Angulated # with posterior cortex in continuity: Closed reduction under anesthesia, followed by percutaneous pinning Completely displaced #: Closed reduction under anesthesia, followed by percutaneous pinning. If fails, go for open reduction Compound # or vascular injury: Open reduction
  • • Undisplaced #: POP immobilization for 3 weeks
  • • Angulated # with posterior cortex in continuity: Closed reduction under anesthesia, followed by percutaneous pinning
  • • Completely displaced #: Closed reduction under anesthesia, followed by percutaneous pinning. If fails, go for open reduction
  • • Compound # or vascular injury: Open reduction
  • • Lateral condylar fracture of humerus is known as fracture of necessity since it often progresses to non-union and needs anatomical reduction and surgical fixation. Treatment includes:
